cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses a new coding scheme for polar codes that allows for flexible block lengths, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions puncturing and shortening techniques, which are commonly used in coding theory (cs.CC). The proposed scheme aims to reduce decoding complexity, which is a topic related to signal processing (cs.SI) and network information theory (cs.NI). Finally, the paper compares the proposed scheme with other length matching techniques, which is a topic related to machine learning (cs.LG).
